relation: Homemade Granola with milk or yogurt
Onion Soup with crouton and swiss
Tomato and Cheese Panini with pesto
Beef Kabobs with Onions, Peppers and Mushrooms
Large mugs on crouton and topped with swiss cheese
Platter with fork Small bowl for cream with spoon
Reheat at 300 degrees for 20 minutes in oven in aluminum foil or in microwave oven
Reheat for 5 minutes at 300 degrees on aluminum tray
7:30 mix granola ingredients and bake for 75 minutes
Set up Friday to start at 7:00 a.m.
11 a.m. make soup 11:30 toast croutons 12:00 fill mugs with soup, top with crouton and slice of swiss; broil or microwave to melt
11:30 Make sandwiches 11:45 Heat on low in sauté plan and weight with a smaller pan until cheese melts
6:00 p.m. Skewer beef and marinate for 30 minutes 6:15 light grill 6:20 cube onions, peppers and mushrooms and skewer 6:40 place skewers on grill
6:15 heat broth and sauté onion 6:30 pour broth onto coucous 6:40 add remaining ingredients
5:00 defrost puff pastry 5:30 slice apples and season 5:40 shape pastry, cover with apples and bake
8:00 Start coffee and turn oven on to 425 degrees
8:00 Mix quiche ingredients and pour into prepared pie shell; 8:15 reduce heat; cook 50 minutes
pageTitle: BoatUS Cookbook - Lori Ross - Easy Entertaining Aboard
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {182341=©2009, Boat Owners Association of the United States, All Rights Reserved.}
textBeforeTable: I always do an inventory of the galley and make a packing/shopping list before we go cruising and if it is not a recipe I know by rote, I make a copy to take with me. Using the recipes, I make a list as follows: My first step is usually a menu, from which I develop an ingredients list to make sure I don’t forget anything important. STEP 2: PROVISIONING   Mimosas Brown Sugar Fruit Honey and nut yogurt Sausage links Quiche Banana bread or blueberry muffins Sunday brunch   Apple Tart Lemon Couscous Beef kabobs with onions, mushrooms and peppers Saturday dinner
textAfterTable: 1 1/2 cups dry white wine   Liquor store 8 cups beef stock √
